ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I have been working on the research for and writing of my senior essay.

I gained experience writing a research proposal and the data analysis involved for my project. Any insights developed were a result of the workshop for senior theses, office hours with Beth our essay consultant, and discussions with my advisors.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: EP&E 492 gives me the flexibility to write my senior essay in an independent study structure.

Though Beth was phenomenally helpful in giving us feedback on our proposals, EP&E really needs to have a seminar style class with small piece meal assignments due (potentially using the Sociology senior seminar as a model). It is too hands off right now, and I think all students could really benefit from having more assignments due from the major and to have a once a week seminar that encourages students to turn in a proposal, literature review, preliminary methods, and a timeline.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to another EP&E student if the student wants to write a full-year essay and/or if there does not appear to be a suitable seminar in which the student would like to write his or her essay.

As other students have said in the past, you have to be very self-motivated if you want to write a senior thesis in this department. While other departments will give you a seminar style class with assignments due, EP&E gives you one research proposal workshop and a proposal due and that's all you have to keep yourself accountable. Find good advisors and create deadlines with them because you're not going to be able to get that level of accountability from this "course".
